name: 1-on-1 English Help Drop-in (Downtown)
description: Need help with your English? English Language Support (ELS) at BCIT provides FREE services for students who need extra help with their English language skills. We are now offering in-person, drop-in (no appointment) 1-on-1 sessions at the downtown campus, Mondays and Wednesdays in Room 305 between 5-6pm. ELS instructors and tutors can help you with: written assignments, presentations, conversational confidence, communication for the workplace, understanding instructions and course expectations, pronunciation, and much more! We offer online and in-person sessions. Sessions fill up quickly!

name: Flexible Learning Operations Management – In-Person Info Session
description:
Ready to put your attention to detail and strong organizational skills to work? Operations Management explores how business enterprises supply, produce, and distribute goods and services to domestic and international markets. You will plan and control product inventory, maintain quality assurance systems, and use project management tools and techniques to deliver projects on time and budget.

This session will cover the flexible learning program offerings within the Operations Management program of study. This in-person session will include a presentation by a subject matter expert and allow you to learn more about the programs.

The programs covered in this session are:

Certificate | Facilities Management
Certificate | Industrial Engineering
Certificate | International Trade and Transportation Logistics
Certificate | Management Engineering
Certificate | Materials Management
Certificate | Quality and Process Management
Associate Certificate | Business Analysis
Associate Certificate | Lean Six Sigma Principles
Associate Certificate | Project Management
Statement of Completion | Lean Business Improvement
Statement of Completion | Six Sigma Business Improvement
Workshops | Project Management

Important Information:

This in-person session is held at the Tech Collider on the second floor of our downtown campus.
The easiest way to reach the Downtown campus is via transit; a paid parking lot is attached to it if needed.
The session starts at 5:00 pm sharp. Please plan to arrive 5-10 minutes early to get settled.

name: English Conversation Cafe
description:
Connect, socialize, and meet people from around the world! This is an opportunity for newcomers to learn about Canadian culture and practice speaking English in a fun, informal, and supportive environment. Open to all international and domestic students enrolled in BCIT courses.

This activity is held at BCIT’s downtown campus.

name: Future Forward: Tech Panel and Networking
description:
Join us for an insightful event designed to help BCIT students and alumni thrive in the rapidly evolving tech industry. Our expert panelists will share valuable tips on essential skills, career growth strategies, and job search techniques. Plus, you’ll have the chance to network with industry professionals in specialized group networking sessions, building connections that can help advance your job search or career.

Panelists include:

- Inga Seelemann, Principal Director, Tech Strategy & Advisory Lead at Accenture
- Nadia Shaikh-Naeem, Vice President, Programs at DIGITAL Supercluster
- Travis Pollitt, Senior Technical Specialist at ICBC
- Mark Ostheidt, System Analyst at OPTIS
- Howard Cheung, Canada Communications & Media Industry Lead at Accenture
- Michael Berg, Security Services Manager at Empyrion Technologies Inc.
- Carolina Ellis, CEO at Tidepool Games

Why Attend?

- Learn from industry leaders who have first-hand experience and knowledge of the Tech landscape.
- Expand your network with industry professionals through small group networking sessions.
- Gain valuable insights to help you advance your career in Tech.
- Get a chance to win exciting door prizes!

We’ll also provide food and refreshments, so come hungry for both knowledge and snacks!
